This will be possible through the use of video
tape recording.
The fact that television and radio are part of
the daily life-experiences of people living in
poverty is one of the most important reasons
for us to relate to those media. This is not
to suggest that the poor will calmly sit at
their television, or radio receivers, and partici¬
pate in our programs, and that is all there is to
it, that is all we have to do, is simply say that
it is there. An effort will be required to
involve the population in the planning and im¬
plementation of those program support materials,
because they will not relate to them simply
because we say they should. They must know that
we will be designing a process together, a
process designed to destroy lethargy and apathy
and bring about a whole pattern of change. It
is that prospect, that possibility which will
be exciting to us all.
